description_txt: stated on January 15, 2015 in an email blast:
quote_txt: "College tuition rates in Texas jumped by 55% since 2003."

description_txt: stated on January 21, 2015 in an interview:
quote_txt: "Documents released from the Soviet Union" show "the Soviet Union started treating" President Ronald Reagan more seriously after Reagan fired the air traffic controllers.

description_txt: stated on January 21, 2015 in a Twitter post:
quote_txt: Only "18 percent of jobs are accessible by transit for metro Atlanta residents. 33 percent for those living in the city."

description_txt: stated on January 20, 2015 in the State of the Union address:
quote_txt: "In Iraq and Syria, American leadership, including our military power, is stopping (the Islamic State’s) advance."

description_txt: stated on January 14, 2015 in State of the State address:
quote_txt: Since Gov. Nathan Deal office in 2011, the state’s rainy day fund has grown by 643 percent.

description_txt: stated on January 26, 2015 in a breakfast talk in Iowa:
quote_txt: The U.S. unemployment rate has "been massaged, it’s been doctored."

description_txt: stated on January 19, 2015:
quote_txt: Assault weapons and handguns are allowed in the state Capitol while bullhorns, trumpets, helium balloons and flags on poles are banned.

description_txt: stated on January 23, 2015 in various social media postings:
quote_txt: The Republican Party has not won a presidential election without either a Bush or a Nixon on the ticket since 1928.

description_txt: stated on January 19, 2015 in a floor speech.:
quote_txt: On assault weapon violence: "Ducks have more protection than people in Virginia."

description_txt: stated on January 13, 2015 in a press release:
quote_txt: Mercedes-Benz USA  moving its headquarters to Atlanta will create at least 800 jobs.

description_txt: stated on January 25, 2015 in comments on ABC's "This Week":
quote_txt: Democrats have "lost more than 900 state legislators" since Barack Obama has been president.

description_txt: stated on January 25, 2015 in comments on "Fox News Sunday":
quote_txt: "You cannot build a little guy up by tearing a big guy down -- Abraham Lincoln said it."

description_txt: stated on January 13, 2015 in a news release:
quote_txt: Middle-class Americans "pay a higher tax rate than millionaires and billionaires."

description_txt: stated on January 1, 2015 in a newspaper commentary:
quote_txt: "The right to vote in this country has never been intrinsically tied to citizenship."

description_txt: stated on January 20, 2015 in a post on his U.S. Senate website:
quote_txt: The Texas leg of the Keystone pipeline "has already created 4,800 jobs in just the year it's been up and running."

description_txt: stated on January 20, 2015 in a Senate Ethics and Elections committee hearing:
quote_txt: Online voter registration is a "more secure" way of doing voter registration.

description_txt: stated on January 13, 2015 in an op-ed in the Wall Street Journal:
quote_txt: "Obamacare has caused millions of full-time jobs to become part-time."

description_txt: stated on January 13, 2015 in mass email:
quote_txt: The merger of Georgia State University and Georgia Perimeter College will make GSU one of the largest universities in the nation, with more than 54,000 students.

description_txt: stated on January 7, 2015 in a speech in Detroit:
quote_txt: "The auto companies have now repaid taxpayers every dime and more of what my administration invested in."

description_txt: stated on January 21, 2015 in a broadcast of MSNBC's "Morning Joe":
quote_txt: Says President Barack Obama is "not paying women equally by his own measures in his own White House."

description_txt: stated on January 15, 2015 in an email blast:
quote_txt: Since Rick Perry became governor, "poverty rates in Texas increased from 15.1% to 17.5% — which is higher than the national average."

description_txt: stated on January 15, 2015 in valedictory speech as governor to the Texas Legislature:
quote_txt: Starting in December 2007, "1.4 million jobs were created in Texas. In that same period, the rest of the country lost 400,000 jobs."

description_txt: stated on January 20, 2015 in the State of the Union address:
quote_txt: "America is No. 1 in wind power."

description_txt: stated on January 20, 2015 in the State of the Union address:
quote_txt: The economy is "creating jobs at the fastest pace since 1999."

description_txt: stated on January 20, 2015 in an analysis of Obama's speech:
quote_txt: In President Barack Obama’s 2015 State of the Union address, "the words ‘al-Qaida’ were never used, the first time those words have not been used in a State of the Union address since February 2001."

description_txt: stated on January 20, 2015 in the State of the Union address:
quote_txt: "Our unemployment rate is now lower than it was before the financial crisis."

description_txt: stated on January 20, 2015 in his 2015 State of the Union address:
quote_txt: "America is No. 1 one in oil and gas."

description_txt: stated on January 20, 2015 in his 2015 State of the Union address:
quote_txt: "Since 2010, America has put more people back to work than Europe, Japan, and all advanced economies combined."

description_txt: stated on January 20, 2015 in the State of the Union address:
quote_txt: The United States is "the only advanced country on Earth" that doesn’t guarantee "paid maternity leave to our workers."

description_txt: stated on January 7, 2015 in an interview with WABE radio:
quote_txt: The religious liberty bill proposed in the Georgia House of Representatives does not specifically exclude corporations, which means they can legally claim a religious exemption.
